title: Prioritization and Filtering using an Adaptive Model for Early Decision-Making in Workflow Systems
authors: Ashutosh Ahuja, Mandakini Gupta, Noor Gumber
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Artificial Intelligence continues to play a pivotal role in reducing decision latency across resource-constrained environments such as operations, logistics, and service delivery. This paper introduces RAID (Rapid AI-Driven Decisions), an adaptive AI framework designed to support early-stage prioritization and filtering in structured decision workflows. The system was evaluated using 17,300 anonymized multivariate records from a publicly available dataset, analyzing combinations of categorical, numeric, and time-series inputs to generate preliminary outcome predictions. These predictions were benchmarked against historical labels and further reviewed for alignment with expert decision patterns. The model achieved an 82% agreement with expert logic, highlighting its potential to assist decision-makers in managing high-volume workflows efficiently. While initially tested in a triage-style scenario, RAID’s architecture is domain-agnostic and can be applied to environments such as inventory optimization, dispatch scheduling, or support ticket prioritization—any setting where intelligent filtering is essential to streamline operations.

title: Recent Advances in the Rice Leaf Diseases Prediction Using Convolutional Neural Networks with Transfer Learning Methods: Concepts, Architectures, Challenges, and Future Directions
authors: Abdul Azis, Tole Sutikno, Abdul Fadlil
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
abstract: The increasing threat from environmental stressors and pathogens has led to a need for improved methods to predict diseases in rice crops. Advancements in machine learning and deep learning, such as Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and transfer learning, have provided pathways for automated disease detection. This study aims to advance rice leaf disease prediction by using CNNs combined with transfer learning, which combines the strength of deep learning to make disease classification more accurate. This approach helps address key issues in farming and reduces resource use by using pre-trained models and tweaking them for specific purposes. The research aims to support sustainable agriculture by providing helpful information using data-driven methods. Plant diseases are complex and require early detection and proper management to prevent major losses. CNNs have become a significant tool in spotting diseases in agriculture, especially rice leaf problems. However, rice leaf disease prediction presents challenges due to the complexity of plant pathology and the lack of knowledge and resources in rural areas. Transfer learning approaches have made CNNs work better and faster, making them more accurate. Progress in rice leaf disease prediction likely hinges on improving convolutional neural networks when paired with transfer learning.

title: Fast Charging of Lithium-Ion Batteries for Electric Vehicles: Concepts, Challenges, and Future Directions
authors: Tole Sutikno, Tri Wahono, Mohd Hatta Jopri
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
abstract: The fast charging technology of lithium-ion batteries is crucial for accelerating the adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) and facilitating the transition to a sustainable transportation system. While it provides convenience in charging and alleviates user range anxiety, this technology encounters various technical and structural challenges. Key issues include the need for effective thermal management to prevent overheating, the degradation of battery capacity due to fast charging cycles, and the necessity for charging infrastructure and cross-manufacturer standardisation. The study looks at how rapid charging works, the importance of battery management systems (BMS), and new ideas for battery materials like silicon-based anodes and solid-state electrolytes. Furthermore, the integration of renewable energy sources into charging infrastructure and the implementation of smart charging systems are critical aspects in developing an efficient and environmentally friendly charging ecosystem. Strong policy support and collaboration among stakeholders are essential to overcoming economic, logistical, and regulatory barriers. Future research should focus on sustainable material development, adaptive battery management strategies, and interoperability of charging systems. With a multidisciplinary approach, fast charging has the potential to underpin safe, efficient, and widely accessible low-emission mobility.

title: Simulation Evaluation of LoRa Performance in Medical Urgent Cases
authors: Ziyad K. Farej, Abdulrahman Y. Adel
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Integrating the Long Range (LoRa) communication technology plays a crucial role in the field of medicine as it improves the patient survival rates in emergencies and urgent cases. Therefore, this paper investigated the ability of LoRa in assisting rapid interventions in real-time medical monitoring in critical cases like pulmonary edema, strokes, and heart attacks, where it is crucial to have early treatment. Known for having long-range and low-power capabilities, LoRa provides reliable and cost-effective solutions for transmitting health data, allowing for a convenient medical intervention. In this study, the major metrics of network performance are evaluated, which involve end-to-end delay, Packet Delivery Ratio (PDR), Received Signal Strength indicator (RSSI), and packet collision rate in order to establish the efficiency of LoRa in dealing with critical medical cases. It was found that LoRa could facilitate real-time monitoring of patients in an appropriate latency, especially in short to medium-range placements. It shows that high PDR is present in close-range devices (≤200m), while low PDR is seen in long ranges beyond 800m, which makes them unreliable. In contrast, network congestion and increased distance of transmission could result in packet loss and higher delays, making it crucial to have strategies for optimizing the network, which may be achieved by implementing multi-gateway architectures and an adaptive spreading factor (SF). Finally, it could be concluded that medical monitoring systems based on LoRa could enhance medical interventions and save lives, which makes it earn a crucial role in the healthcare field.

title: Multi-Label Classification Algorithm for Toxic Comment Detection in Online Forums
authors: Gurram Vijendar Reddy, Monisha Jothi. R, Muhamed Husseyn, Utkarsh Anand, V.P. Arul Kumar, Ali S. Haleem, Enas R. Alwaily, Mohammed Abdulsalam Alhayaly
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Though the growth of online forums has caused a revolution in digital communication, it has also led to more negative behavior exhibited by members. Because of the many characteristics of toxicity, which can show itself as insults, threats, vulgarity, or hate speech often happening simultaneously inside a single comment, it is a difficult process to find and categorize toxic comments. This complicates the process of spotting and classifying harmful comments. Being created to identify and classify various toxicity in online communication precisely, TOX-MULTINET is a ground-breaking multi-label classification tool. This paper presents TOX-MULTINET. A neural ensemble architecture is included in the framework proposed after creation. Comprising Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for the extraction of contextual features, Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory (BiLSTM) for sequential dependency learning, and an attention mechanism for enhancing interpretability, this architecture consists of When compared to other models thought to be at the cutting edge of technology, TOX-MULTINET outperforms them in precision, recall, and F1-score. All of this is achieved using training and assessment procedures utilizing benchmark datasets available to the general public. The findings of the studies show that the algorithm is strong enough to manage overlapping hazardous categories, therefore improving the accuracy of detection in situations that exist in the real world. The model offered offers a method for filtering user-generated content that is both scalable and adaptable. This approach is meant to help create online communities more supportive of good living.

title: Beyond Detection: Ensemble Learning for Arabic Fake News Identification and Proactive Social Media Blocking
authors: Ali Saad Khuraib, Siti Norul Huda Sheikh Abdullah, Masnizah Mohd
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Social media is a widespread platform for disseminating fake news, which has become a common threat to national security and democratic governance systems worldwide. In this paper we propose an ensemble learning approach that works on Arabic social media networks by combining two meta-learning algorithms with three base classifiers to detect and block fake news while efficiently blocking the important links on the network. It develops accuracy verification standards specific to Arabic language processing while implementing an early-warning prototype system that uses multi-feature extraction and meta-classifier ensemble methods. The framework is designed not just to detect but also preemptively block and measure risk, prioritizing actions according to what we view as detrimental to the public, while also reducing the amplification of harmful content without unduly restricting free speech. The paper works to improve Arabic natural language processing for misinformation detection that can ultimately inform practical guidance for balancing content.

title: Measurement of Sugar Intake in Food Using Image Recognition and Volume Estimation
authors: Gaurav Singh Bisht, Parul Madan, Ankit Vishnoi, Preeti Narooka, Karan Singh Bisht, Shanjal Gupta
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: Accurate measurement of sugar intake is crucial for people with prediabetic disorders and other diseases that require precise diet and lifestyle management. Traditional methods often ignore actual food intake, resulting in inaccurate estimation of sugar intake. The goal of this research is to improve food sugar estimation by offering a novel method that combines image recognition and volume estimation. The technique makes use of deep learning models, such as monocular depth estimation for accurate volume measurement and Mask R-CNN for effective food segmentation. After conversion of the calculated volume of food to weight, the total sugar content can be determined using nutritional information. Testing it on several food images confirmed its efficiency and demonstrated reliable segmentation and volume estimates. This novel strategy improves nutritional management tools and has the potential to increase the precision of diet in consumer health applications and clinical settings, which will ultimately lead to better health outcomes.

title: Hybrid Quantum-Classical Neural Network (HQCNN) for Crypto Price Forecasting
authors: Md Shujan Shak, Nabila Rahman, Fuad Mahmud, Ashim Chandra Das, Arifa Akter Eva, Anika Sayeema
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things (AIBThings)
abstract: Cryptocurrency price prediction remains a challenging problem due to the highly volatile nature of digital asset markets. This study introduces a Hybrid Quantum-Classical Neural Network (HQCNN) for cryptocurrency price forecasting, leveraging quantum feature encoding and extraction with deep learning architectures. The proposed model utilizes Quantum Convolutional Neural Networks (QCNN) to enhance feature representations, which are then processed by classical deep learning models such as Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) and Transformer networks. Experimental results on historical cryptocurrency data demonstrate that HQCNN outperforms state-of-the-art models. The proposed model achieves a mean absolute error (MAE) of 0.023 and a root mean squared error (RMSE) of 0.036, surpassing traditional deep learning methods such as LSTM (MAE: 0.040, RMSE: 0.056) and Transformerbased models (MAE: 0.035, RMSE: 0.050). Ablation studies confirm the importance of quantum feature encoding, as removing it degrades performance by up to $\mathbf{3 8. 2 \%}$. Additionally, HQCNN reduces inference time to 7 milliseconds, making it suitable for real-time trading applications. Despite its advantages, HQCNN faces challenges related to quantum hardware constraints, training overhead, and interpretability in financial decision-making. Future work will focus on deploying the model on real quantum processors, integrating reinforcement learning for market adaptability, and enhancing interpretability with quantum explainability techniques.

title: AI-Driven Scheduling Algorithm for Maximizing Renewable Energy Utilization in Smart Grids
authors: Masudjon Norbo‘Tayev, Bobir Tojiboyev, Maftuna Mullajonova, Komiljon Tuychiyev, Mukhtasarkhon Abdullayeva, Hasanin Alshamri, Ahmed Abd AL-Kadem Hadi
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Intelligent networks' increasing usage of renewable energy sources presents challenges in the energy balancing demand and supply because of their erratic nature. This work seeks to increase a set of AI-oriented scheduling criteria that guarantee the optimal use of renewables even as it preserves grid stability and optimizes power distribution. The proposed method uses deep reinforcement learning and real-time energy predictions to allocate energy sources dynamically. The algorithm changes programming for this goal and allows for variations in renewable energy generation using historical and real-time data. Experimental results indicate that the AI-captured method greatly promotes the use of renewable energy, lowers reliance on traditional energy sources, and maintains normal grid efficiency. A comparison with traditional scheduling methods confirms the improved performance of the energy rate and the device's dependability. It examines the smart grid age by providing an intelligent and statistics-oriented approach to maximize the Utilization of renewable electricity and boost energy sustainability.

title: Real-Time Detection of Alzheimer’s Relatives via Fusion of Two Parallel Deep Convolutional Networks
authors: Yasmine M. Tabra, Khansaa Dheyaa Aljafaar
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things (AIBThings)
abstract: Alzheimer’s patients (AP) frequently experience memory loss concerning their relatives’ names and identities, and they may not always have access to permanent companionship. This paper proposes a system that utilizes a camera, activated by voice commands, to detect relatives in real-time, thereby assisting patients in recognizing their family members. Furthermore, notify the nearest authorized relative via email regarding visitors. This paper presents the architecture of the Fusion of two parallel Deep Convolutional Neural Networks (F2PDCNet). This architecture comprises three primary components: Deep Cascaded Network (DCNet), Deep Doubled Features Network (DDFNet), and Accumulative Convolution Neural Network (AcCNet). The proposed architecture enhances accuracy and decreases recognition time utilizing the merging of generated dataset (KaYa 25) and subset of VGGFace2 dataset. Th generated dataset is derived from photographs of the patient’s relatives and serves as the training material for the proposed deep network. During the identification phase, 150 photographs were captured from a live video stream using the Pi Camera Module 2 connected to a Raspberry Pi. The proposed architecture demonstrated a detection time of $\mathbf{1. 1 7 m s}$ and achieved $\mathbf{1 0 0 \%}$ recognition accuracy, reflecting a 0.4% improvement over existing literature utilizing the same dataset.

title: Multimodal Data Fusion in Neuroscience: Promises, challenges, and future directions [Special Issue on Accelerating Brain Discovery Through Data Science and Neurotechnology]
authors: Chuang Liang, Rogers F. Silva, Tulay Adali, Rongtao Jiang, Daoqiang Zhang, Shile Qi, Vince D. Calhoun
publish: IEEE Signal Processing Magazine
abstract: Multimodal fusion provides significant benefits over single-modality analysis by leveraging both shared and complementary information across diverse data sources. In this article, we systematically review methods for the fusion of heterogonous multimodal biomedical data of varying dimensionality (including neuroimaging, biomics, clinical phenotypes, and text), with a focus on neuroscience. We discuss the strengths and limitations of these strategies based on a survey of 302 research articles. Next, we examine the applications of these methods to a variety of scenarios spanning a continuum from scientific research to clinical practice. Finally, an in-depth discussion of common challenges and promising directions for future development of multimodal biomedical data fusion are provided. Overall, multimodal fusion shows substantial benefits and transformative potential in the field of neuroscience. Future research should prioritize improving model generalization, enhancing interpretability, addressing inherent data limitations, and developing unified platforms alongside multimodal foundational models to bridge the gaps among fusion techniques, research, and application to various domains.

title: An Intelligent Maternal Care System Using Sensor Fusion and AI
authors: Anika, Lavanya M, Madhubala M, Namratha R, Rashmitha Rani B N, Nagamani K
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: Maternal mortality remains a critical global health challenge, with approximately 280,000 maternal deaths annually due to preventable pregnancy-related complications. This paper presents a comprehensive review of an intelligent maternal care system that integrates sensor fusion technology and artificial intelligence to address the growing need for continuous maternal health monitoring. The proposed system combines multiple physiological sensors including ECG monitors (AD8232), pulse oximeters (MAX30100), temperature sensors (DS18B20), motion sensors (MPU6050), galvanic skin response sensors, and environmental monitoring devices to provide real-time assessment of maternal and fetal wellbeing. The system architecture employs a React-based frontend interface with Firebase cloud infrastructure for scalable data storage and real-time synchronization. Machine learning algorithms analyze multi-parameter sensor data to enable early detection of critical conditions including preeclampsia, gestational hypertension, anemia, sleep disorders, mental health complications, and maternal infections. The integrated platform facilitates bidirectional communication between healthcare providers and patients through secure messaging systems while providing predictive risk assessment and clinical decision support tools. Environmental factors are incorporated through air quality and humidity sensors to provide contextual health assessments. The system's predictive analytics capabilities enable proactive intervention strategies, potentially reducing maternal mortality rates and healthcare costs while improving accessibility to quality prenatal care, particularly in resource-limited settings. This comprehensive approach to continuous maternal monitoring represents a significant advancement in leveraging Internet of Medical Things (IoMT) technology for improved pregnancy outcomes and demonstrates the potential for AI-driven healthcare solutions to address critical gaps in maternal care delivery.

title: Seeing Beyond Frames: Zero-Shot Pedestrian Intention Prediction with Raw Temporal Video and Multimodal Cues
authors: Pallavi Zambare, Venkata Nikhil Thanikella, Ying Liu
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things (AIBThings)
abstract: Pedestrian intention prediction is essential for autonomous driving in complex urban environments. Conventional approaches depend on supervised learning over frame sequences and require extensive retraining to adapt to new scenarios. Here, we introduce BF-PIP (Beyond Frames Pedestrian Intention Prediction), a zero-shot approach built on Gemini 2.5 Pro. It infers crossing intentions directly from short continuous video clips enriched with structured JAAD metadata. In contrast to GPT-4V-based methods that operate on discrete frames, BF-PIP processes uninterrupted temporal clips. It also incorporates bounding-box annotations and ego-vehicle speed via specialized multimodal prompts. Without any additional training, BF-PIP achieves 73% prediction accuracy, outperforming a GPT-4V baseline by 18%. These findings illustrate that combining temporal video inputs with contextual cues enhances spatiotemporal perception and improves intent inference under ambiguous conditions. This approach paves the way for an agile, retraining-free perception module in intelligent transportation systems.

title: A critical Review of Landfill Leachate and its treatment by Electrochemical Oxidation: A Future energy-Oriented Approach for Sustainable Liquid Waste Treatment
authors: Sadique Khan, Muhammad Shariq Vohra
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: Landfill leachate, a highly toxic liquid waste produced because of the degradation of municipal solid waste (MSW) and the ingestion of rainwater through waste layers, poses a significant environmental concern due to the presence of huge organic content, heavy metals, and other persistent contaminants. The nature and concentration of pollutants vary depending on landfill age, composition, and climatic factors. The larger the landfill age, the less will be the biodegradability of its organic content, and hence content shifts from easily degradable compounds to more recalcitrant substances, including humic and fulvic acids. Conventional leachate treatment method such as biological treatment and physicochemical techniques often possesses drawbacks of aged leachate, particularly in removing recalcitrant contaminants and achieving significant reductions in COD and ammonia levels. Hence, a multi-stage treatment approach is required to meet environmental standards. Electrochemical Oxidation (EO) is a viable approach of advanced oxidation process for leachate treatment since it fully degrades the organic content even if it is recalcitrant in nature, operating without any chemical transport, and with almost negligible sludge generation. EO is highly efficient in removing complex organics and ammonium nitrogen, especially in old leachate. This technology aligns with global sustainability goals and offers a pathway for developing compact, efficient treatment systems for challenging wastewater streams. The paper also discusses the integration of EO with biological systems and renewable energy sources (RES) to improve energy efficiency, reduce carbon footprint, and enable decentralized leachate treatment in smart cities and sustainable waste facilities.

title: Transmissive Dual-band Polarization Converter Based on Metal-Only Metasurface at V-Band
authors: Defi Lestari, Dian Widi Astuti, Umaisaroh Umaisaroh, Noor Asniza Murad, Mudrik Alaydrus
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
abstract: Polarization of waves plays a significant role in many radiating and scattering problems. It is desirable to have the capability to design electromagnetic structures that can convert the polarization of the wave. In this work, low-profile metal-only two-layer structures were proposed to achieve a functionality to convert wave polarization. The lower layer is rotatable to enhance the functionality of the polarization converter. The simulation results showed that, without rotation, there are just transmissive structures at the frequencies 34.1, 40.1, 44.2, and 49 GHz. A 90-degree-rotated lower layer gave an orthogonal polarization at the frequencies 34.9 and 40.2 GHz, whereas a 45-degree-rotated lower layer led to a polarization 45 degrees at the frequencies 35.1 and 44.4 GHz.

title: EmotionNet CL Deep Learning Framework for Real Time Emotion Aware Feedback in Smart Classrooms
authors: Suresh Babu Kondaveeti, T. Vijaya Sagar, Marwan Aziz Mohammed, Neelam Sharma, Jawad Radhi Rustum Al-Assal, I Infant Raj
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: In recent years, Artificial Intelligence (AI) has significantly enhanced student engagement and learning outcomes in educational environments. To provide instant classroom feedback, this paper introduces a novel framework of AI Enhanced Learning Environment that uses real time emotion recognition. Unlike traditional systems who rely solely on the academic performance metrics, we leverage on facial expression and behavioral cues for assessing the emotional state of students such as confusion, boredom or engagement during the lesson time. The main contribution is the implementation of a continuous feedback loop of real time emotion detection and design of adaptive instructional strategies. A convolutional neural network and long short-term memory architecture is used to process the multimodal input to classify emotions very accurately. Based on these insights, we visualize the dynamic dashboard where the educators can change the pace of teaching and the content delivery, as well as the way of interaction with students according to the affective feedback. Passive classrooms can become emotion responding classrooms through this emotion aware mechanism thereby adding inclusivity and increasing in real time student comprehension. In addition, the deployment takes into consideration privacy preserving modules and ethical protocols for safe deployment. By design of an emotion intelligent education system, this integrates affective computing into the pedagogical design and by doing so it shows a pioneering approach towards emotion intelligent education systems where student centered learning is enhanced with Artificial Intelligence.

title: A Multimodal Surveillance System for Detecting Cheating Behaviors in Online Exams
authors: Sangeetha V, Shivansh Shukla, Vaibhav Raina, Puru, Surya Nirbhay Singh
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: The digital transformation of education, accelerated by global events such as the COVID19 pandemic, has led to a significant increase in online learning and remote examinations. While these innovations provide convenience and flexibility, they also introduce challenges in maintaining the integrity of assessments. Cheating during online exams is a growing concern, as students exploit the lack of physical invigilation to engage in dishonest practices. The proposed model is to develop an AI-driven Surveillance Cheating Detection System to ensure fairness in virtual assessments using deep learning techniques. The system employs real-time computer vision and audio analysis for face detection, eye gaze tracking, multiple face recognition, and behavioral monitoring. The results obtained with the model reveals robust performance, with face detection accuracy exceeding 95 % and frame processing latency below 300 ms. With enhanced monitoring accuracy and reducing manual effort, the model can uphold integrity and trust in digital assessments.

title: Average Achievable Rate Analysis of Cell-Free Massive MIMO in the Finite Blocklength Regime with Imperfect CSI
authors: Kai Chen, Feng Ye, Jiamin Li, Pengcheng Zhu, Dongming Wang
publish: 2025 6th Information Communication Technologies Conference (ICTC)
abstract: Acquiring perfect channel state information (CSI) introduces substantial challenges in cell-free massive MIMO (CF-mMIMO) systems, primarily due to the large dimensionality of channel parameters, especially under ultra-reliable low-latency communication (uRLLC) constraints. Furthermore, the impact of imperfect CSI on the average achievable rate within the finite blocklength regime remains largely unexplored. Motivated by this gap, this paper proposes a novel analytical framework that provides a closed-form expression for the average achievable rate with imperfect CSI in the Laplace domain. We demonstrate analytically that both the channel dispersion and the expected channel capacity can be expressed explicitly in terms of the Laplace transform of the large-scale fading component. Numerical simulations confirm that the derived expressions match closely with Monte Carlo simulations, verifying their accuracy. Furthermore, we theoretically show that although imperfect CSI degrades performance in the finite blocklength regime, the inherent characteristics of CF-mMIMO architecture effectively mitigates this loss.

title: SeizAI: A Secure AI-Based Seizure Detection via Homomorphic EEG Encryption
authors: Sunil Gupta, Md Abu Sayeed
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things (AIBThings)
abstract: Epileptic seizures, triggered by irregular electrical activity in the brain, pose serious health challenges for millions worldwide. Accurate, secure and timely detection of seizures is vital to improve patient outcomes and quality of life. This work presents a secure, real-time seizure detection framework driven by artificial intelligence (AI) utilizing machine learning algorithms and homomorphic encryption (HE). This framework ensures data privacy and compliance with healthcare regulatory requirements while enabling computational analysis directly on encrypted data. To address class imbalance and improve model performance, methods including fixed-length signal segmentation and sliding window approaches were applied. The widely used CHB-MIT and Bonn EEG datasets were used for validation. Among the models tested, XGBoost achieved the best results, with an average accuracy of 90%, a precision of 87%, and a sensitivity of 92%. The proposed approach underscores the potential of integrating machine learning with encryption technologies to develop secure and accurate seizure detection systems, paving the way for innovative and privacy-preserving solutions in healthcare.

title: Ripple Current Estimation in AC filters of Voltage Source Converters
authors: Lorenzo Giuntini
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: The Voltage Source Converter is a popular power electronic conversion topology, and an enabling technology in renewable energy applications. The converter is typically coupled with some form of AC filter to attenuate switching harmonics, the most common topologies being LC and LCL filters. Typical filter design techniques require estimation of the switching inductor current ripple, which is also the base for estimating the current ripple on the filter capacitor. This paper introduces a technique for estimating the current ripple by averaging the instantaneous ripple, allowing the extension of known DC-DC conversion equations to PWM converters processing AC voltages. The proposed approach simplifies the ripple current estimation and may be extended to multi-level conversion topologies. The technique is validated via simulation, and experimentally on three-level Neutral Point Clamped converters.

title: AI-Driven Innovations in Stock Exchanges: A Systematic Review
authors: Vaishnavi Kini, Varsha, Praveena Kumari M K
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: The integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) into stock exchanges has transformed the financial sector by advancing data processing, market forecasting, and trading methodologies. AI technologies-including machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, and algorithmic trading-have played a key role in boosting market efficiency, enhancing liquidity, and accelerating transaction speeds. Innovations such as high-frequency trading (HFT), AI-based risk evaluation, fraud detection, and predictive analytics have strengthened both decision-making and financial security. Despite these advancements, the implementation of AI in financial markets presents notable challenges, including regulatory hurdles, data integrity issues, ethical dilemmas, and the potential for market manipulation. Furthermore, the convergence of AI with blockchain technologies and cryptocurrencies, along with the emergence of fully automated trading platforms, highlights a dynamic and fast-changing environment. These developments offer considerable potential but also raise significant concerns, making it essential to balance innovation with responsible oversight.

title: Artificial Intelligence Based Forest Fire Early Warning System in Turkey and the Mediterranean Basin: Analysis of Economic and Ecological Losses and Land Use Changes
authors: Öykü Süzgün, Murat Beken
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: This study covers the development of an artificial intelligence (AI)-based image processing system for the early detection and prevention of forest fires that cause serious ecological, economic and social losses for Turkey and the countries in the Mediterranean basin, the performance of this system and the analysis of multidimensional losses caused by fires. The developed system presents a deep learning model trained on the EfficientNetV2B1 architecture using a dataset consisting of synthetic and real images, and the test accuracy of the model has reached $97 \%$. In addition, forest fire statistics in Turkey and Europe were analyzed comparatively, and it was emphasized that Turkey is in a better situation compared to countries such as Spain, Italy and Greece in terms of burned area per fire, but the critical importance of protecting the existing limited forest assets is emphasized due to the low ratio of forest assets to the country’s surface area. The study shows that this AI-based early warning system can make an important contribution to the fight against fires and statistically deals with land use changes after forest fires, revealing the transformation trends to agriculture and settlements, especially after large fires.

title: Design and Simulation of Smart Blind Cane for Visually Impaired People
authors: Pan Gao, Yan Yang
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Human-Computer Interaction (ICHCI)
abstract: Aiming at the contradiction between the traveling safety needs of the visually impaired people and the single function of the existing blind cane, this paper designs a multi-sensor fusion intelligent blind cane system. The design innovatively integrates event camera (DAVIS), ToF ranging sensor and millimeter wave radar, and realizes the closed loop of environment sensing-decision-making-interaction through the STM32+NPU dual-processor architecture: (1) the sensing layer adopts the event camera (DAVIS) to capture the dynamic target, and combines with the ToF sensor and the millimeter wave radar to construct the three-dimensional environment model, and realizes the multi-source data fusion through the Bayesian estimation; (2) the decision layer proposes an improved A* algorithm, which introduces a dynamic safety factor and direction priority optimization, and improves the safety of path planning by 50%; (3) the localization layer adopts the Adaptive Monte Carlo Localization (AMCL) algorithm, which improves the particle convergence efficiency by 62%. Experiments show that the system can realize obstacle detection (delay <0.1s), dynamic obstacle avoidance and accurate navigation, providing technical support for the barrier-free construction of smart cities.

title: TrafficSense-DTLS: An AI-Driven Dynamic Signal System for Seamless Urban Mobility Using YOLOv8
authors: Viraj Chudasama, Sachin Chavan, Sunita Barve
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: Conventional traffic light systems, which run at set intervals without adjusting to actual road conditions, are the cause of the ongoing problem of traffic congestion at metropolitan junctions. This inefficiency leads to needless delays, higher fuel use, and higher emissions, all of which worsen environmental and economic issues. In this study, we offer a Dynamic Traffic Light System (DTLS) powered by YOLO (You Only Look Once), an advanced object detection system, to enable real-time, vision-based traffic control. The system records live traffic footage from strategically placed cameras, dynamically adjusts signal timings based on vehicle density, and detects and counts vehicles at intersections. Nearby intersections also convey traffic conditions to prioritize high-traffic locations, such as emergency routes near schools and hospitals. To foresee congestion patterns and proactively optimize traffic signal modifications, the model integrates predictive analytics with historical traffic data. This improves traffic flow, decreases wait times, and increases urban mobility. The system is a practical and sustainable option for smart city applications due to its modular and scalable architecture, which facilitates easy integration into current urban infrastructure.

title: Adaptive Neuro-Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) for Clinical Decision Support in Remote Patient Monitoring
authors: Hawraa M. Kadhim, Tholfiqar Z. Ismail, Gaurav Tamrakar, Yusufjanov Ulugbek Javlon Ugli, Sampath R
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: The ANFIS combines the learning capabilities of neural networks with the human-like reasoning of fuzzy logic, enabling intelligent decision-making. In remote patient monitoring, ANFIS can play a crucial role in providing timely and accurate clinical support. Existing methods often struggle with real-time analysis, low interpretability, and limited adaptability to dynamic physiological changes, resulting in delayed or inaccurate diagnoses. To address these challenges, a novel ANFIS-Based Hybrid Decision Support System (ANFIS-BHDSS) is proposed, which integrates wearable IoT sensor data with ANFIS for continuous, adaptive, and explainable clinical decision-making. The proposed system monitors vital signs, including heart rate, temperature, and blood pressure. It infers risk levels for critical conditions, including sepsis, enabling early intervention through automated alerts and recommendations. This approach enhances the accuracy and reliability of decision support in remote settings while maintaining transparency for clinical validation. Experimental results demonstrate improved performance in detecting early warning signs with higher sensitivity and specificity compared to traditional models. The proposed method proves effective in enhancing patient safety, reducing hospitalization rates, and supporting healthcare providers in making proactive clinical decisions.

title: Research into a Model-Based Channel Estimation Method for Terahertz Communications
authors: Weizhuo Zhu, Xiaoli He
publish: 2025 6th Information Communication Technologies Conference (ICTC)
abstract: To address the challenges of poor performance and insufficient accuracy in channel estimation for near-field multiple-input single-output (MISO) terahertz communications, this paper proposes a novel algorithm that integrates model-driven deep learning with approximate message passing. The proposed approach leverages a planar antenna array to construct a dedicated system model for near-field terahertz MISO communications. By combining Orthogonal Approximate Message Passing (OAMP) with Spatially-Adaptive Feature Modulation (SAFM), we develop a trainable network architecture tailored for terahertz near-field MISO systems. The algorithm not only ensures convergence in linear estimation but also enhances noise reduction through fixed-point iteration while exploiting non-local feature dependencies, thereby improving detection accuracy. Compared to standalone SAM or OAMP, the proposed SAM-OAMP demonstrates superior detection performance under identical experimental conditions. Experimental results indicate that the bit error rate (BER) and mean square error (MSE) of the enhanced approximate message passing algorithm decrease progressively with increasing signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), leading to a significant improvement in overall system performance.

title: Predicting Life Insurance Risk Using Deep Learning
authors: Shikha Singh, Ashish Tiwari, Arvind Kumar Singh, Hemant Kumar Singh, Vipin Kumar Chaudhary, Riya Johri
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: Forecasting the risks associated with life insurance is crucial for the effective design of underwriting frameworks, the construction of models for pricing, and formulating corporate policies pertaining to investments. Governance policies on risk within the insurance sector and, more broadly, insurance policies themselves require accurate life insurance risk forecasting. The traditional actuarial techniques for forecasting life insurance risks have become obsolete due to the vast amounts of insurance data available today. This research makes use of the more advanced techniques of predictive analytics, specifically deep learning, and provides an explanation for how these techniques improve the risk assessments within life insurance. The proposed model leverages a Multilayer Perceptron (MLP) design to differentiate complex data structure involving demographics, clinical, and behavioral data to assess risks accurately, a step other approaches have failed to achieve. The sequential design of the data preparation and the subsequent feature construction techniques ensures the model can operate reliably and maintain functional accuracy. The problem with the lack of explanation of predictive outcomes within deep learning is addressed within the research by incorporating exAI techniques. The research demonstrates the positive influence of deep learning on the underwriting analytics of life insurance making it more advanced. This is likely to improve the underwriting practices of life insurance by making risk a more equitable and science-based approach.

title: Deep Q-Networks for AI-Powered Traffic Signal Optimization in Smart Cities to Reduce Congestion and Improve Transportation Efficiency
authors: Fahim Multani, S. Subburam, Muntader Mhsnhasan, Mariyam Ahmed, Gummagatta Vybhavi Yajaman, Zahraa N. Salaman, Sajjad M Al-Hakeem, Sajad Ali Zearah
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Optimal traffic flow in cities worldwide is largely achieved through regulating traffic lights. Much study has gone into figuring out the best way to time signals. Optimization models that construct the signal plan using fixed parameters form the basis of most of these studies. Reinforcement learning (RL), a model-free alternative to traditional approaches, can sidestep these problems. This alternate can figure out the best control approach by experimenting. The scale learning capabilities of deep neural networks have made deep RL approaches more appealing in recent years. The reason for this is the difficulty of dealing with actual traffic situations. By adjusting the timing of lights in response to actual traffic conditions, intelligent traffic signal controllers have effectively decreased gridlock. The paper proposed Adaptive DQN for optimized traffic flow (ADQN-Opti Traffic flow), a subset of Deep Q-Networks that allows for real-time adaptation of signal timings to current traffic circumstances. ADQN-Opti Traffic flow improves traffic flow and decreases congestion by using RL and modeling traffic signal control as a Markov decision process(MDP) to reduce the vehicle wait time. By analyzing data collected from cameras, sensors, and networked vehicles, the model can make judgments that adapt to its current environment. ADQN-Opti Traffic flow utilizes a deep neural network to learn the appropriate transition between signal phases. Recalling past occurrences and computing Q-values allow us to do this. The deep actor-critic methodology outperforms other deep reinforcement learning methods and the conventional model-based approach on several criteria, as shown in simulated experiments.

title: Research on Small Object Detection in Aerial Images Based on the RT-DETR Model
authors: Pan Chai, Mei Wang, Yizhuo Jia, Xinyu Liu
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Computer Systems (ICCS)
abstract: To address the challenges of multi-scene nighttime small object detection from UAV perspectives, this paper proposes an improved model, FSP-RTDETR, based on RT-DETR. The method constructs a lightweight backbone network, CG-FasterNet, to enhance feature extraction efficiency; introduces the SPDConv module to strengthen small object feature representation and optimize positional information fusion; combines the CSP structure with OmniKernel to form the CSP-OmniKernel module, improving multi-scale feature fusion capability; and employs a cross-attention mechanism to focus on target regions while suppressing background redundancy. Experiments on the VisDrone2019 dataset demonstrate that FSP-RTDETR outperforms the baseline model with improvements of 3.69%, 3.87%, 5.14%, and 3.85% in accuracy, recall, mAP@0.5, and mAP@0.5:0.95, respectively, validating its effectiveness in nighttime small object detection.

title: Secure Image Steganography Using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), Hash-Based Message Authentication Code (H-MAC) and Enhanced Least Significant Bit (LSB) Technique
authors: Jagdish Kapadnis, Satish Bhadane, Pundlik Jadhav, Prasad Lahare, Ashrita Joshi, Chetan Patil
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: Now-day's in digital world secure information is rapidly exchange over the internet, which impact on digital security. Most of the time images and pictures are used to hide secrete information, there is need of advanced encryption methods to hide the confidential information. The proposed work focus to enhance the security, through image steganography. Three techniques through which security is provided, Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), Hash-Based Message Authentication (H-MAC) and Enhanced Least Significant Bit (LSB). So the combination of encryption and steganography will provide most effective solution to concealment for secure the information. The LSB method uses least significant bits of pixel value, and these pixel values of image are substituted with concealed message. This is chosen for its simplicity and minimal impact on image quality. The image is used as base for embedding the message and carrier for concealed data. Hidden message is encrypted using AES algorithm before embedding after successfully transfers image seamlessly decrypt the message for authorized parties. By using these methodologies make sure that, data exchanges with integrity and confidentially. This research paper represents practical insights of implementing various advanced security techniques and comparative results are compared with existing techniques.

title: Machine Learning Prediction Model in Preschool Education: Predicting Children's Future Learning Performance and Interest Trends
authors: Songni Xu
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: This study aims to investigate the ability of ML models to forecast Preschool children’s future academic performance and trends in their interest. A review of relevant literature was done to assess how Decision Trees, Random Forests and Neural Networks can predict learning outcomes, and enhance personalized learning. The review notes that it is worth noting that the accuracy of the ML models is very high when making the prediction of the data outcomes depending on its quality as well as the algorithm chosen. Some of the most important challenges were revealed to be ethical, such as data privacy and data fairness. Given biases that exist in data gathering and design of the algorithms involved, marginalized children are most likely to be affected, and this is why it is crucial to establish things such as the; FairAIED. The authors then proceed to give recommendations to future research about adaptive ML models, as well as shallow and deep hybrid approaches, in addition to other bias handling approaches to ensure that machine learning in preschool education works for all students, and specifically, address the ethical issues it raises concerning privacy and fairness.

title: Planning the power system of Senegal
authors: Becegade Amar, Noé Diffels, Bertrand Cornélusse
publish: 2025 IEEE PES/IAS PowerAfrica
abstract: This paper presents a methodology for designing the investment plan of the Senegalese power system by 2050, covering both the electrical generation and the transmission network. Using Python for Power System Analysis (PyPSA), multi-period power system optimizations are conducted to evaluate different investment strategies. Various scenarios are explored, incorporating the existing generation assets. Additionally, two sensitivity analyses are performed to quantify the impact of CO<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</inf> emission constraints on the average cost of electricity per MWh.

title: Develop a Optimized Routing and Security Framework for IoT Networks. Design a Adaptive Backbone Routing with Rsa-Based Secure Packet Transmission in Packet-Switched Networks
authors: Srinivasan D N, Thoshith Kumar B, Umesha K N, Kiran V
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: The resource limitations of processing power together with energy constraints and bandwidth limitations and the movement of nodes in IoT networks create specific operational difficulties. The Adaptive Backbone Routing (ABR) protocol solves these issues by performing three main functions. Backbone nodes selection through an energy-based metric combined with link quality and connectivity measurements, path selection based on energy considerations which reduces control overhead by 32 % compared to AODV protocol and enables automatic network topology adjustments. The ABR protocol achieves 0.49 packets/sec throughput with 1.01s latency and produces 0.272242 PER which demonstrates strong error correction capabilities. The security system uses 512-bit RSA encryption with automatic key distribution which increases energy consumption by 12 % from the base 9.38 J value. The combination of adaptive routing with a 15 -second update interval and lightweight cryptography ensures dependable operation in resource-limited environments by increasing PDR by 27 % compared to standard protocols while securing data from end to end. The network demonstrates stable performance across different conditions because the ABR maintains a 0.000313 BER throughout its links.

title: Efficient Over-Threshold Multi-Party Private Set Intersection
authors: Junjie Tang, Kai He, Minhua Su, Haolin Pang, Meifang Jian, Jianan Liu
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Human-Computer Interaction (ICHCI)
abstract: Private Set Intersection (PSI) enables multiple parties to compute the intersection of their private datasets without revealing additional information. Over-Threshold Multi-Party PSI (OT-MP-PSI) extends this by allowing parties to identify elements that appear in at least t sets, while preserving privacy. Existing OT-MP-PSI protocols suffer from high computational costs and limited practicality. This paper proposes an efficient OT-MP-PSI scheme based on robust secret sharing and oblivious pseudorandom functions, leveraging two non-colluding cloud servers to minimize overhead. Our protocol avoids expensive public-key operations and significantly improves performance.The experimental evaluation demonstrates a significant improvement in efficiency, with our protocol outperforming existing approaches by at least an order of magnitude.

title: Tomato Leaf Disease Detection Using an Improved YOLOv5
authors: Chao He, Weidong Tang, Qiuming Liu, Linghui Liu
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Human-Computer Interaction (ICHCI)
abstract: To address the degraded feature extraction and low accuracy caused by leaf occlusion and small-object lesions under complex field conditions, this paper proposes YOLOv5-CSA, a tomato leaf disease detector built upon YOLOv5. The method enhances region awareness by integrating the CBAM(Convolutional Block Attention Module)into the backbone, enabling more targeted localization of diseased leaf areas. To better capture long-range dependencies while controlling computational complexity, LSKA(Large-Separable Kernel Attention) is incorporated into the SPPF(Spatial Pyramid Pooling–Fast) module. In addition, the neck is redesigned with C3_ScConv to strengthen lesion feature extraction, suppress redundant/duplicate gradients, and improve sensitivity to small objects. Experimental results demonstrate that the improved YOLOv5-CSA achieves an mAP@50 of 92% and a recall of 98.0%, representing gains of 2.8% and 1.0% over the baseline YOLOv5, respectively.

title: Hill-Climbing Method using Solar Irradiance Estimation for a PV System with a Capacitor directly Connected to Power Converter Input
authors: Seiya Hattori, Takumi Soeda, Hitoshi Haga
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: This paper proposes a hill-climbing method to improve the performance of searching for the maximum power point (MPP) in a capacitor-directly-connected photovoltaic (PV) system, in which an additional capacitor is directly connected between a PV module and a power converter. The PV system improves PV output electrical energy by discharging the additional capacitor and compensating for the insufficient power required for the power converter to operate when solar irradiance decreases. However, the additional capacitor reduces the variation speed of the PV operating point. The difference in PV output power due to fluctuations in solar irradiance is relatively larger compared to that due to variations in the PV operating point. Therefore, the conventional hill-climbing method fails to search for the maximum power point (MPP) when solar irradiance fluctuates. The proposed hill-climbing method creates reference values based only on difference in PV output power due to the variations in the PV operating point and the PV operating point achieves tracking to the MPP. The simulation and experimental results show the proposed hill-climbing method improves PV output electrical energy of the capacitor-directly-connected PV system by $10.6 \%$ on a sunny day and by $13.7 \%$ under gradually increasing solar irradiance compared to the conventional hillclimbing method.

title: Scalable Retail Intelligence: BI Dashboards, Analytics, and Cloud Data
authors: Shireesha Gorgilli, Saurabh Mittal, Shiva Kumar Ramavath, Peeyush Patel, Samariddin Makhmudov, Poshshajon Abdullaeva
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: In these times retail is changing fast, and a lot of that comes down to how companies are using data to make decisions all along the supply chain. With tools like BI dashboards, cloud systems, and big data tech, businesses aren't just keeping an eye on things anymore. They're actually able to react quickly, improve customer service, and fine tune their plans. In this paper, we're looking at how business intelligence tools team up with cloud data systems to help companies scale up their analytics and use them in real time. We'll walk through some real-world examples of how BI is being used, talk about the tech you'd need to get started, mention a few challenges, and then explore what might be possible down the road with predictive analytics

title: Automated Multimodal Ticket Classification in Public ITSM Systems Using Hierarchical Attention and Deep Neural Networks on Mixed-Format Inputs
authors: Suha Abd, Bourair Al-Attar, Hayder Abdulameer Yousif, Abdul Karim Luaybi Al-Rubaie, Haider Alzamily, Anas Diab Sallibi, Shimaa A Zeeb, Neha Divekar, Nilisha Itankar
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: This research presents a high-accuracy AI framework for automated multimodal ticket classification in public ITSM systems, integrating hierarchical attention networks, deep transformer embeddings, and cross-modal fusion layers. Leveraging fine-tuned language models and mixed-format service datasets—including structured metadata, unstructured issue descriptions, and semi-structured attachments—the system was evaluated across citizen services, infrastructure support, and municipal IT operations. The model consistently achieved classification accuracies of up to 97.1%, with F1-scores reaching 0.94 and interpretability scores as high as 0.94. Compared to rule-based or unimodal models, the proposed architecture reduced misclassification rates by over 25% and enhanced decision transparency through SHAP-based interpretability and attention weight visualization. The integration of contextual language representations, service-specific structured features, and semantic label hierarchies enabled robust triage, top-k intent prediction, and real-time service routing. Despite deep architectural complexity, the model maintained sub-2.5 second training cycles, validating its deployment feasibility across large-scale public ITSM infrastructures. The architecture is platform-agnostic and adaptable to evolving service taxonomies without requiring structural reengineering.

title: Revolutionizing Personalized Medicine: AI-Driven Predictive Analytics for Disease Diagnosis and Treatment Optimization
authors: Dilli Ganesh V, Nandhini T J, Prashant Johri, Anmar Alrawas, Ahmed A. Elngar
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Medical care for patients is changing by using artificial intelligence to predict diseases and boost treatment results. This research examines how machine learning and deep learning enhance healthcare by facilitating more accurate disease detection and creating personalized treatment plans for individual patients. AI systems process mixed health information from hospital records, medical test results, and patient DNA data to identify diseases earlier and develop more effective treatment plans. The analysis checks the performance of logistic regression-supported vector machines SVMs, as well as random forests and powerful deep learning CNN-RNN systems. Deep learning technologies surpassed ordinary methods in disease detection by producing a test accuracy of 94.8%. Artificial intelligence systems minimize treatment failures while increasing treatment success for different medical conditions by 14% and 16%. Natural barriers like heavy computing power demands and biased programs need fixing before medical use can become the normal practice. This research shows that AI can improve personalized medicine but demands fairness enhancements to make healthcare equally available to all patients. New research needs to update AI systems using real-patient health records to help doctors make better medical choices and achieve better results for their patients.

title: Power System Stabilizer Performance Optimization in a Multimachine Power System Under High Renewable Energy Penetration Using Genetic Algorithm
authors: Abdelrahman Taha, Mohammed A. Hajahmed
publish: 2025 IEEE PES/IAS PowerAfrica
abstract: With the growing penetration of renewable energy sources in modern power systems, the demand for advanced stability enhancement techniques has become increasingly critical. The Power System Stabilizer (PSS) plays a pivotal role in improving system stability, thus emphasizing the importance of developing methods to further enhance PSS performance. In this study, the IEEE 9-bus system was modified to better reflect the complexity of actual power systems by integrating a fourth generating unit connected via a transformer to bus seven, along with the addition of a solar power plant. Since each generating unit exhibits unique dynamic characteristics, their individual responses to disturbances can lead to complex interactions that pose significant challenges to overall system stability. To address this, the study proposes a novel hybrid tuning approach that combines the Genetic Algorithm (GA) with the Integral Absolute Error (IAE) criterion to optimize PSS parameters, thereby maximizing the damping of system oscillations. The proposed tuning method achieved a 7.3% reduction in IAE over the conventional method and a 26% improvement compared to the system without PSS, demonstrating superior damping performance.

title: CardioShield: Data-Driven Risk Stratification for Heart Disease Patients
authors: Mamatha V, Lakshmi B N, Varchas V, Tanish Pandey, Preetham Gowda R
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: One of the biggest causes of death in the world today is heart disease. Improving patient outcomes and lowering healthcare costs need early detection and diagnosis. Using clinical characteristics such age, gender, blood pressure, cholesterol, and the type of chest discomfort, this study attempts to create a machine learning-based predictive model for the diagnosis of heart disease. Patients are classified as having or not having cardiac disease using the Random Forest and Support Vector Machine (SVM) algorithms. Standard performance criteria including accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score are used to assess the suggested model. The outcomes show that the machine learning algorithms are successful in correctly predicting cardiac problems, giving medical personnel a trustworthy diagnostic aid. Our logistic regression model achieved a test accuracy of 88.52%, with a precision of 0.89 and an F1 score of 0.88.

title: Edge AI for Smart Healthcare: Real-Time Vital Sign Monitoring and Predictive Alerts in Emergency Care
authors: Dilli Ganesh V, Nandhini T J, Prashant Johri, Abdelmoty M. Ahmed, Mahmoud Mahfuri
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: In this paper, a new approach to bringing Edge AI into smart healthcare is proposed, and for this purpose, realtime vital sign monitoring and the emergency care alert system are given as examples. Employing wearable IoT sensors, local edge processing, and AI-based predictive analytics on patient data is beneficial since it leads to timely responses and advancement in clinical procedures. Some of the parameters include the heart rate, blood pressure, oxygen saturation rate, and respiratory rate, against which the system can check for abnormalities instantly. By so doing, the system takes preventive measures in dangerous scenarios like cardiac arrest, respiratory failure, and others that would have occurred or are about to occur, by giving early alerts to the concerned health professional if they are likely to happen. This cuts down on time use in intervention, especially in developing world scenarios where interventions may be needed for conditions such as famine or other epidemic-like situations. The Edge AI system has advantages such as low latency levels, data protection, low power consumption, and an organizational structure to counter the issues of network volatility and reliance on the cloud. Therefore, the implementation of the proposed system with the AI algorithms at the edge level means better patient outcomes, early detection, fewer mortalities, and optimal utilization of resources. The effectiveness of the method in real-time prediction and decision-making in emergency care delivery sheds light on the possibility of using the methodology to introduce social change in the dispensation of quality health care.

title: Addressing Gender Imbalance in Cirrhosis Prediction with CTGAN and Transformer-Based Generative Models
authors: Divya Saxena, Naphtali Rishe
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things (AIBThings)
abstract: Cirrhosis is a severe liver condition characterized by irreversible scarring due to chronic liver damage. Early detection is critical for effective treatment and improved patient outcomes. This study investigates the application of various machine learning models for cirrhosis prediction, including Random Forest (RF), Logistic Regression (LR), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Multilayer Perceptron (MLP), and a hybrid CNN-Long Short-Term Memory (CNN-LSTM) model. To address the gender imbalance in the dataset-where male samples outnumber female-synthetic data generation techniques are applied, with a focus on Conditional Generative Adversarial Networks (CTGAN). Two hybrid balancing approaches are also explored: one combining CTGAN with Edited Nearest Neighbors (ENN) and the other with the Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique (SMOTE). This paper introduces a novel generative framework, the Transformer-Conditional Generative Adversarial Network (TransCTGAN), which incorporates Transformer-based selfattention layers into both the generator and discriminator of the CTGAN architecture. The effectiveness of synthetic data is assessed through model performance improvements after dataset balancing. Our results demonstrate that CTGAN-based augmentation significantly boosts predictive accuracy, showing the potential of synthetic data in enhancing machine learning models. While not all models show marked improvement, the approach effectively mitigates class imbalance without introducing bias toward the male-dominated class.

title: Sustainable Desalination Using Wind-Powered MultiStage Vacuum Membrane Distillation
authors: Mohamed Kotb, Atia Khalifa, Mahmoud Elboghdadi
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: This study introduces a novel wind-powered multistage Vacuum Membrane Distillation (VMD) system designed for sustainable and off-grid freshwater production. The system directly harnesses wind energy to operate essential components, including an electric heater, water pumps, and a control unit under two distinct operational modes: a battery-assisted mode and a real-time wind-driven mode. A water ejector is employed to maintain vacuum conditions passively, eliminating the need for mechanical vacuum pumps. The multi-stage configuration enables thermal energy recovery between stages, significantly enhancing system efficiency. Parametric Analysis revealed that increasing the feed temperature from $40^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$ to $80^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$ raised water productivity from $13 \mathrm{~kg} /$ day to $60 \mathrm{~kg} /$ day, a $362 \%$ improvement, while the Unit Production Cost (UPC) dropped from $47 \mathrm{~S} / \mathrm{m}^3$ to $9 {\$} / \mathrm{m}^3$ (an $80.9 \%$ reduction). Additionally, vapor flux increased from approximately $40 \mathrm{~kg} / \mathrm{m}^2 . \mathrm{h}$ to $181 \mathrm{~kg} / \mathrm{m}^2 . \mathrm{h}$ under optimal conditions, and permeate pressure was reduced to below 5 kPa with increased pump flow rates. The system demonstrated its strongest economic performance at wind speeds above $6.5 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$, achieving a minimum UPC of $3.5 \mathrm{~S} / \mathrm{m}^3$ at $8 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$, representing a $94 \%$ cost reduction compared to operation at $3 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$. This windpowered VMD configuration offers a scalable, energy-efficient, and cost-competitive solution for freshwater production in windrich, remote, or off-grid regions.

title: An Ensemble Framework for Video Authentication Using File Signatures, Metadata Analysis, and Deep Learning-Based Quantization
authors: Zou Qingqing, Nur Hanis Sabrina Suhaimi, Siti Norul Huda Sheikh Abdullah, Nazhatul Hafizah Mohd Kamarudin
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: The rapid advancement of multimedia technologies and mobile devices has led to expanding digital video formats, enabling dynamic communication and immersive entertainment experiences. However, this digital convenience has also facilitated manipulating video content for fraudulent and unethical purposes, posing significant threats to information integrity and public trust. Video forensics has become increasingly critical, with authenticity detection at the forefront of ensuring multimedia credibility. However, the existing tampering detection methods often suffer from limited feature extraction capabilities and insufficient detection accuracy. This paper proposes an integrated video authentication framework combining three complementary techniques: file signature verification, metadata analysis, and quantization-based deep learning recognition to detect video forgery robustly. The ensemble-based framework improves accuracy, generalizability, and resistance to manipulation across diverse scenarios. Experimental evaluations demonstrate that the proposed deep learning quantization model achieved an accuracy of 95% on the VISION dataset and 71% on the CSM dataset. Furthermore, when integrated with metadata and file signature verification, the combined framework significantly outperforms individual methods in detecting tampered videos. The results highlight the effectiveness of a multi-layered approach to video forensics. Future improvements, such as incorporating more diverse datasets and enhancing fusion algorithms, are expected to further advance the reliability of video authentication systems, supporting critical applications in digital forensics, media verification, and judicial evidence validation.

title: Speech Synthesis from EEG Signals Using Machine Learning Techniques
authors: Asmaa Chehab, Lina Benna, Maryam Alsabaa, Sultan Alshehhi, Omar Alhussein, Jamal Zemerly, Chan Yeun
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Locked-in syndrome (LIS) presents a profound communication barrier for individuals unable to produce spoken or physical responses. This study presents a practical paradigm for speech synthesis from electroencephalogram (EEG) signals using machine learning techniques, focusing on inner speech classification. Inner speech is well suited for real-life applications, aligning naturally with the cognitive process of LIS patients while expressing themselves without additional effort or cues. EEG data were collected corresponding to six critical words, “help,” “pain,” “no,” “yes,” “up,” and “down” as participants focused on the meaning and connotation of these words without vocalization. The raw EEG signals were subjected to Band-pass and Band-stop filtering, followed by Wavelet transform for frequency domain analysis. Processed data were fed into a diverse set of models, including Random Rorest, Light Gradient Boosting Machine (LightGBM), Extreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost), Multilayer Perceptron (MLP), and a tuned Support Vector Machine (SVM), representing ensemble, neural, and kernel-based approaches. This study shows that XGBoost achieved the highest accuracy (93%) in the 3-word classification task, while LightGBM performed best in the 6-word task (87%), with both models achieving competitive results relative to the literature. This paper dives further into the techniques used in data collection, processing, and classification. The results of this study highlight the potential for real-time, noninvasive communication systems for LIS patients, paving way for brain-computer interface solutions that restore a fundamental human need: the ability to express thought.

title: Implementation of Improved Sobel Edge Detection on FPGA
authors: Kiran Kumar J Purad, S Praveen
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: Edge detection is a fundamental task in image processing, essential for object recognition and structural analysis. The Sobel operator is popular for its simplicity and hardware efficiency but suffers from noise sensitivity, thick edges, and fixed thresholding limitations. To address these, this paper proposes a high-performance FPGA-based edge detection system comprising three variants. The first is a baseline Sobel implementation using standard <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$3 \times 3$</tex> kernels. The second is a Modified Sobel method incorporating tuned kernels, Non-Maximum Suppression (NMS), and Adaptive Thresholding to improve edge sharpness and noise resilience. The third leverages Winograd Minimal Filtering to reduce multiplications and optimize resource usage. All designs are implemented in Verilog and synthesized on a Xilinx Artix-7 FPGA using Vivado. The architectures are designed to process streaming image data efficiently using line buffers, pipelined convolution units, and resource-aware logic. Image outputs are evaluated using visual clarity, while hardware utilization is analyzed using LUT, BRAM, and DSP reports. The Modified Sobel shows superior edge continuity, especially in low-contrast areas, while the Winograd-based method significantly reduces DSP usage and latency. Overall, the results indicate that both enhanced approaches outperform the traditional Sobel in edge precision and hardware scalability, making them well-suited for deployment in embedded vision pipelines, surveillance, and realtime robotic systems.

title: PIN Authentication Using Morse Code
authors: Ranjani G, Swapna H A, Chandrashekar Gurammanavar, S Balaji, Darshan B Surname, Aishwarya D M
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: This paper presents a secure, inclusive, and multimodal authentication framework that integrates real-time facial recognition, Morse code input via eye blinks or mouse gestures, and OTP- based verification. The system is designed to address both accessibility challenges faced by users with physical impairments and modern cybersecurity threats such as spoofing, key-logging, and shoulder surfing. Using a standard webcam and lightweight Python-based modules, the system detects live user faces, verifies them via CNN-encoded embedding, and enables secure PIN/password entry through intentional blink duration interpreted as Morse code symbols. A fallback mechanism using keyword verification and Morse-based password reset further enhances usability and resilience. The proposed solution operates offline using local encrypted storage (SQLite), requires minimal hardware, and provides real-time visual feedback via GUI. This work extends prior research on resistive Morse systems by introducing a complete, low-cost, end-to-end biometric authentication model with practical applications in banking, health care, and secure terminals.

title: A decision-making method for Engineering Change of Commercial Aircraft based on dynamic multi-layer Knowledge Graph
authors: Hongyang Sun, Meina Zhang, Xinyuan Zhang, Xu Meng
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Human-Computer Interaction (ICHCI)
abstract: In response to the challenges in the Engineering Change Management of complex products represented by commercial aircraft, such as the difficulty in identifying the scope of influence, fragmented decision-making basis, and low reuse rate of historical experience, this paper proposes an intelligent decision-making method based on a dynamic multi-layer knowledge graph. Firstly, a three-level knowledge architecture is constructed: the data structure layer precisely models the assembly relationship of components and document dependencies to achieve the automatic parsing of change propagation paths; the attribute association layer integrates dynamic attributes such as supply chain status, inventory fluctuations, and the validity period of regulations; The decision semantic layer facilitates explainable reasoning by identifying critical elements related to engineering changes, leveraging the relational network of historical problems, corresponding solutions, and their associated impacts. Based on this architecture, a change decision-making model is developed, introducing a mixed coefficient to balance expert experience and data patterns, and combining the dynamic threshold of historical case statistics to output graded decision-making suggestions. In the verification of a commercial aircraft Flight Control system change case, this method improves the accuracy of impact analysis and the efficiency of obtaining decision-making basis. It is verified that this method effectively breaks through the limitations of cross-domain data silos, providing decision support covering the necessity judgment for engineering changes, and has theoretical value and engineering practical significance for the change management of intelligent manufacturing systems.

title: Integration of Cross-Vendor PLCs Using Modbus TCP/IP Protocol in Industrial Automation Systems
authors: Murie Dwiyaniti, Hatib Setiana, Respati Prajna Vasthi, Adam Risky Muharam, Rizqi Elok Fatihah Lutfi, Nanda Afrian Nurzeha, Nuha Nadhiroh, Danang Widjajanto
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
abstract: The development of Industry 4.0 has made industrial automation more complex, especially in integrating PLCs from different vendors due to differences in architecture, programming software, and communication protocols. This study addresses that challenge by designing and implementing a real-time, two-way communication system between Schneider Modicon TM221 and Siemens SIMATIC S7-1200 PLCs using the open Modbus TCP/IP protocol. The system was tested in a laboratory through several scenarios, such as data exchange, time synchronization, network interruptions, and device restarts. Test results showed 100% accuracy in data transmission and synchronization delays between 2 and 18 milliseconds—well within the limits for real-time applications. The system also recovered automatically from disruptions within 2 to 18 seconds, depending on the type of disturbance, with most scenarios showing no data loss. These findings demonstrate that Modbus TCP/IP is a reliable solution for integrating PLCs across different platforms, allowing smooth communication and coordination. The proposed system is practical, scalable, and suitable for industrial settings that require high interoperability, reliability, and minimal downtime.
