title: Ethically-Constrained Mental Health Chatbot for University Students: A Context-Aware NLP System using LLMs
authors: Rizma Adlia Syakurah, Latius Hermawan, Meilinda, Deris Stiawan, Muhammad Qurhanul Rizqie, Noer Triyanto Roesli
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
abstract: Limited access to mental health services, cultural stigma, and societal barriers continue to hinder help-seeking behaviors among Indonesian youth. While chatbots offer promising digital support, ethical, clinical, and safety concerns remain underexplored. This study investigates the foundational development of mental health chatbots for Indonesian university students by identifying key ethical considerations. Using reflective and exploratory design methodology focused on mapping ethical risks and developing a conceptual framework, data were gathered through expert interviews and focus group discussions involving AI developers, psychologists, and bioethics specialists. Results highlight four central challenges: ethically sourcing training data, defining nonclinical chatbot roles, ensuring cultural-linguistic sensitivity, and integrating a responsive safety keyword protocol. The chatbot’s role was refined to act as a peer-like first responder offering empathetic support and referral, not diagnosis. Interdisciplinary collaboration was critical to maintaining clinical boundaries and user protection. Ultimately, chatbot systems must be developed as ethically grounded, culturally responsive, and professionally supervised tools that complement, not replace, human mental health care and protect vulnerable users.

title: Energy Management for Hybrid System using Backstepping Controller
authors: Ibrahima Touré, Claude Bertin Nzoundja Fapi, Alizera Payman, Mamadou-Baïlo Camara, Brayima Dakyo
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: Effective energy management in hybrid systems represents a major challenge for improving the performance, autonomy, and durability of embedded applications, particularly in the fields of transportation and renewable energy. This article proposes an energy management strategy based on backstepping control, applied to a hybrid system combining multiple energy sources. The chosen architecture is based on a continuous bus, sized to meet the different load demands. The system utilizes the energy produced by photovoltaic modules, with a maximum power point tracking algorithm based on backstepping control, as well as the energy stored in a battery, in order to meet the variable energy needs. The developed control method allows an optimal distribution of power between the different sources, ensuring the stability of the overall system. The backstepping control scheme takes into account the physical constraints of the components as well as the variations in energy demand. A dynamic modeling of the system is first presented, followed by the development of the controller and the analysis of its stability using Lyapunov’s theory. Simulation results validate the proposed approach, showing a significant improvement in energy efficiency, dynamic response, and management of transitions between sources. Finally, the robustness of the control system in the face of uncertainties and disturbances is also evaluated.

title: A Comparative Analysis of Machine Learning Algorithms for Predicting Human Behaviour
authors: Aahana Saha, Navdeep Sindhu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: Human behaviour prediction has become a key area of research with applications in social sciences, marketing, healthcare and security. This paper aims to compare and contrast various machine learning algorithms based on their performance prediction of human behaviour on a variety of datasets. K-nearest neighbours (KNN), decision trees, random forests, support vector machines (SVM), and artificial neural networks are the kinds of algorithms that are examined in this article. To identify the optimal method for behavioural prediction, performance parameters like accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score are computed. Being able to predict human behaviour is a major focus for many fields where understanding and predicting the individual and group level behaviours of humans is of interest. Predicting things like customer purchases, internet behaviour or social interactions can enhance social welfare and drive corporate growth. Machine learning also gives us powerful techniques for exploring behaviour patterns in complex data sources. The field of intelligent environment development finds several uses for behaviour modelling. It has been used for a variety of tasks, including classifying various diseases, forecasting customer behaviour and operations, and illustrating energy consumption. Particularly, behaviour prediction helps to predict users' future development as well as to spot those actions that vary from the predicted behaviour. This work investigates and contrasts numerous behaviour prediction techniques and suggests the usage of embeddings to reflect the user activities. The objective of this paper is to compare the predicted capabilities and limitations of well-known algorithms.

title: CryptoGuard: An AI-Based Cryptojacking Detection Dashboard Prototype
authors: Amitabh Chakravorty, Jess Kropczynski, Nelly Elsayed
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things (AIBThings)
abstract: With the widespread adoption of cryptocurrencies, cryptojacking has become a significant security threat to crypto wallet users. This paper presents a front-end prototype of an AI-powered security dashboard, namely, CryptoGuard. Developed through a user-centered design process, the prototype was constructed as a high-fidelity, click-through model from Figma mockups to simulate key user interactions. It is designed to assist users in monitoring their login and transaction activity, identifying any suspicious behavior, and enabling them to take action directly within the wallet interface. The dashboard is designed for a general audience, prioritizing an intuitive user experience for non-technical individuals. Although its AI functionality is conceptual, the prototype demonstrates features like visual alerts and reporting. This work is positioned explicitly as a design concept, bridging cryptojacking detection research with human-centered interface design. This paper also demonstrates how usability heuristics can directly inform a tool’s ability to support rapid and confident decision-making under real-world threats. This paper argues that practical security tools require not only robust backend functionality but also a user-centric design that communicates risk and empowers users to take meaningful action.

title: DNADeepNNet: Deep Learning Framework for Genomic Sequence Classification and Regulatory Motif Discovery
authors: Shilpa M, C Nandini, Manasa Sandeep
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: The integration of Deep learning into the field of bioinformatics has transformed the way biological data is analyzed, interpreted, and utilized. Deep Learning methods can handle vast volumes of high-dimensional and complex data generated by biological research. We propose DNADeepNNet, a Deep Learning framework for motif discovery and DNA sequence classification. DNADeepNNet, a hybrid architecture combines kmer frequency-based statistical feature extraction with advanced deep neural network models. This enables effective learning of both local sequence patterns and global context. The framework uses Probabilistic algorithms, Expectation- Maximization and Gibbs sampling to identify functional sequence motifs. The proposed DNADeepNNet framework achieves training accuracy of 94-95% and Test accuracy of 88-89%.

title: Integrating LLMs for Automated Bug Triaging and Root Cause Localization in Software Systems
authors: Prajwal Pisal, Prateek Jalan, Solomon R Chigurupati, Chandrakanth Puligundla, Srinivas Bhogavalli
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things (AIBThings)
abstract: Existing techniques often depend on manual processes or limited models for machine learning that do not capture complex, multimodal dependencies between code, infrastructure and runtime behaviour. This paper presents an AI-driven approach using Large Language Models (LLMs) for efficient bug triaging and proactive root cause analysis. Our system integrates graph-based modelling, multimodal learning, and LLMs to automatically triage bugs, predict root causes, and generate effective test cases for bug reproduction. We evaluate the proposed framework’s effectiveness using various basic models from existing literature, including traditional machine-learning classifiers and graph-based models. The results show that our method is significantly higher than the baseline approaches in the average time to resolution (MTTR), the accuracy of the root cause (RCA) and the effectiveness of the test case (THE), achieving a reduction of MTTR by more than 50%, an RCA of 84.7% and a THE of 83.2%. Our approach improves the efficiency and accuracy of bug triaging and software quality assurance by generating reliable test cases.

title: Designing a Framework for 6G Networks Infrastructure for IoT Communication in Smart Hospitals
authors: Niki Pourazin, Siavash Khorsandi
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Internet of Things and Applications (IoT)
abstract: Smart hospitals play a key role in healthcare's digital transformation, driven by the integration of intelligent systems. 6G cellular technology, with ultra-high bandwidth and ultra-low latency, suits many IoT hospital applications, but deploying and managing networks remains challenging due to diverse requirements and cost constraints. This work proposes a framework for access layer design in 6G-based Smart Hospitals. The main focus of this framework is the APP problem. The framework either extends existing infrastructure or determines initial AP placement and types (known as the initialization block). Real-world factors are then integrated, and each AP is locally optimized to best serve the UEs within its serving set (known as the optimization block). In the initialization block, we present a weighted k-means clustering algorithm, optionally enhanced with a novel Node Adjustment mechanism to reduce dependence on weight heuristics and yield more realistic placement. We also introduce a rule-based AP type-assignment strategy, ensuring compliance with cluster requirements and budget limits. The optimization block defines a realistic model using a radius-based serving set. Experimental results show that both k-means and weighted k-means yield similar results in terms of cost and coverage metrics. However, the weighted method demonstrates superior performance in departmental coverage.

title: CNN-Integrated Autonomous Farm Vehicles for Precision Weed Detection and Crop Management
authors: Ahmed Shahebaaz, K. Preethi, Mujahedullah H Syed, V. Bini Marin, A. Antony Luki, S. Murugan
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: This study examines the integration of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) using automated farm machinery for accurate weed detection and crop oversight. The suggested system employs a CNN-based image classification algorithm to evaluate current information from cameras with high resolutions utilised by automatic vehicles. The method classifies weeds from plants with an accuracy of 99.41 %, markedly improving the efficacy of weed control compared to conventional methods. In agricultural testing, the robotic vehicles shown a 30 % reduction in applying pesticides while maintaining crop production efficiency. The technique enhanced water efficiency by adjusting watering plans based on crops condition, leading to a 20 % reduction in water use. Moreover, the autonomous vehicles proficiently detected and addressed economic stressing issues, leading to a <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{15\%}$</tex> increase in overall crop yield. This study demonstrates the capacity of CNN-powered self-driving vehicles to improve both the along with and the effectiveness of contemporary agriculture, offering a feasible option for accurate cropping with significant ecological and economic benefits.

title: Application of Blockchain for Registering and Safeguarding Real Estate Property Rights
authors: Hanaa Salih Alkhrbeet, Alaa Hussein Ali, Khalida ABDulsattar Salim, Saeed Hameed Aldulaimi, Marwan Abdeldayem
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Blockchain is one of the most important technologies at the present time, and it is one of the most important products of the technological development that resulted from the Fourth Industrial Revolution, which is moving with rapid steps towards the digital revolution, so this technology has occupied the prominent topic in the field of technological progress, because it has caused a major breakthrough in the world of economics. Digital technology, through the security and transparency it provides in real estate transactions, in addition to the pursuit of decentralization and abandoning the centralization that dominates real estate investments, and this technology is still the subject of study and consideration in all disciplines, especially law, because the effects it produces are of great interest to researchers, especially with regard to The transfer of ownership of the sold item and how to prove it. This study recommends the legislator to developing an integrated legal system that regulates transactions through this technology. Also, Jurisprudence calls for holding conferences and seminars on this topic due to its importance at the economic and legal levels.

title: X2Power: A Framework for Industry’s Energy Needs in a Power2X World
authors: Ahmed Khan Leghari, Christian Kloch, Rasmus Reeh, Asger Nordlund
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: Power2X or P2X refers to the conversion and storage of electricity produced using different production means and turning it to carbon neutral fuels that can be used in a wide variety of industry. P2X is an important tool to achieve carbon neutrality such as EU’s Green Deal initiative that sets year 2050 to become climate neutral. To make P2X initiative successful it is important to develop methods, strategies and frameworks that ensure competitive energy prices while meeting growing energy demands of the industry. The current model of energy production, distribution and consumption dates back to the first Industrial Revolution. At that time coal, oil, and natural gas was the primary source of energy for the industry, however, in a P2X world, the industry needs major changes in the existing model of production, distribution and consumption of energy to be more sustainable but also commercially viable. This paper proposes strategies to develop a framework that is not only sustainable but also commercially viable for the industry to embrace P2X initiative and reduce their carbon footprint to achieve carbon neutrality goals.

title: Revolutionizing Energy Markets with Blockchain-based P2P Trading for Electric Vehicles
authors: Manjunatha B A, Mohan Bangalore Anjaneyalu, Satish E G, Mamatha Bai B G, Basavaraj G N
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: Green transport is increasingly replacing carbon- emitting vehicles worldwide. Electric energy is now more important as a result of the widespread use of electric vehicles (EVs), These vehicles are different from conventional fossil fuel-powered vehicles, particularly in terms of how long it takes to maintain them. Electric vehicle-charging service provider (EVSPs) must be requested to schedule charging time appropriate in advance. Well-organized management will demand for electric vehicle charging stations, which may increase as a result of energy trading between providers and consumers, which can reduce the cost compared to conventional power utility companies. Although relying on third-party platforms lacks security and exposes users to attacks and privacy leaks, the majority of EVSP services are based on them. In this paper, the system on renewable energy is proposed. So, it requires the friendly mobility app connect to the nearby charging station. It also eliminates third- party platforms through a blockchain database mechanism and create a multi-faceted security system between electric vehicles and Service Providers(SPs). In proposed work, by completing distributed Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) identity registration, digital certificates can be obtained. User registration is decoupled from verification, eliminating reliance on EVSP for information security. Smart contracts are used in the verification process to address issues with centralized verification and opaque services. There is a outline in system deployment's implementation details on the Ethereum blockchain platform. The users can pay the charging fee through an e-wallet. Furthermore, Cost calculations and develop an Android app, which makes users easily accessible is presented. The suggested system minimizes human interaction while fostering EV participant privacy, trust, and transparency.

title: Point Cloud Projection Semantic Segmentation Framework Based on the SAM Foundation Model
authors: Jian Xu, Dingding Jia, Peng Shao, Chao Peng, Qitong Wan, Chenxi Dong, Zhaoxiang Zhang, Yuelei Xu
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Human-Computer Interaction (ICHCI)
abstract: Point cloud semantic segmentation is crucial for perception in unknown environments and 3D scene understanding. However, the sparsity of point clouds and the information loss from projection methods limit the segmentation accuracy. This paper proposes a point cloud semantic segmentation framework that combines the visual large model Segment Anything Model(SAM) with a lightweight Refinement Module. Efficient segmentation is achieved through point cloud projection and an improved SAM encoder–decoder, while Refinement Module compensates for spatial information at the point level. Experiments on the SemanticKITTI dataset demonstrate that this method improves mIoU by 3.3% compared to current methods and shows advantages in categories such as buildings, fences, and vegetation, thereby validating the potential and application value of visual large models in point cloud semantic segmentation.

title: Graph Contrastive Learning for Fraud Detection in Financial Transactions Using AI-Powered Anomaly Detection in Banking and E-Commerce
authors: Adilbek Dauletov, Khurshida Bakhrieva, Akhat Azamatov, Mumin Babajanov, Noorayisahbe Mohd Yaacob, Shaimaa Ahmed Abd, Alaa Khalid Abdalreda, Baqer A Hakim
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: The rapid evolution of financial fraud in banking and e-commerce renders conventional detection techniques insufficient. This work presents a Graph Contrastive Learning (GCL) framework, FraudGraph-CL, meant to improve fraud detection in financial transactions. The suggested method demonstrates complex interactions among consumers, transactions, stores, and gadgets by simulating financial operations as a heterogeneous graph. By using contrasting learning, depictions of nodes are enhanced, thereby enabling strong fraud classification even in low-data or hostile settings. Utilizing graph augmentation techniques such edge tampering and feature masking to improve anomaly identification, FraudGraph-CL combines Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) with contrastive loss optimization. By 12.3% compared to state-of-the-art models, FraudGraph-CL increases fraud detection accuracy by 95.2%, 94.8% precision, and 96.1% AUC-ROC experimental outcomes on real-world financial datasets. Providing a scalable, real-time fraud protection system, the suggested framework is relevant in banking, digital payments, e-commerce platforms, and financial regulatory systems. FraudGraph-CL much improves fraud detection efficiency, interpretability, and adaptability against changing fraud techniques by using graph-based relational learning and self-supervised neural networks

title: Emotion-Aware Music Generation for Personalized Soundtracks in Digital Media Using Transformer-Based AI Models
authors: S Govinda Rao, D. Beula, Pooja Sahu, Ramy Riad Al-Fatlawy, M.S. Gowtham, Mehdi Ebady Manaa, Ahmed Abdulsalam Alhayaly
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Music is a fundamental aspect of generating emotions and creating engaging user experiences in different applications of digital media, such as film, gaming, and interactive narrative. Classical algorithmic composition techniques are incapable of producing contextually meaningful and emotion-aware music in real-time. The emergence of artificial intelligence (AI), especially Transformer-based models, in recent years has demonstrated tremendous leaps in music generation. Though present models cannot dynamically modify music with respect to emotional cues, hence restricting their suitability in creating personal soundtracks, this study has the goal of creating an emotion-aware music generation system that learns to adapt based on user emotions through Transformer-based AI models. The suggested framework utilizes self-attention mechanisms in Transformers to create individualized soundtracks from emotional input signals. We train the model on large symbolic music datasets (e.g., MIDI, MAESTRO) and incorporate affective computing methods to translate user emotions into musical features like tempo, pitch, and harmony. Objective (perplexity, tonal coherence) and subjective (human listening tests) evaluations are performed. Experimental findings suggest that the Transformer model surpasses conventional recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and GAN-based methods in preserving emotional coherence and musical structure. Subjective testing verifies that users find the produced soundtracks to be emotionally consistent with presented input cues. This study shows the potential of AI-based, real-time affective music generation, opening the door to individualized, adaptive soundtracks for multimedia applications. Future research will concentrate on the multimodal emotion recognition integration for enhanced accuracy.

title: Quantum-Inspired Swarm Optimization Algorithm for High-Frequency Stock Trend Forecasting
authors: Mayas Aljibawi, Salam Ahmed, Sachin Pradhan, Abdusamiev Dilmurod Abdugani Ugli, Shanmughapriya M
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: High-frequency stock trend forecasting is a critical component of financial decision-making that requires accurate and rapid prediction capabilities. Traditional optimization and prediction models often fall short in capturing the non-linear, volatile, and time-sensitive nature of high-frequency financial data. Existing swarm-based and deep learning techniques suffer from slow convergence, local optima entrapment, and lack of adaptability to dynamic market conditions. To overcome these limitations, this paper proposes a novel Quantum-Inspired Swarm Forecasting Algorithm (QISFA) that integrates principles of quantum mechanics with particle swarm optimization (PSO) and deep learning to enhance forecasting performance. QISFA utilizes quantum-inspired behavior to improve population diversity and exploration capability while coupling with Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM)-based neural networks for capturing temporal dependencies in stock prices. The proposed method is tested on real high-frequency stock datasets and benchmarked against standard models. Experimental results demonstrate that QISFA significantly outperforms traditional PSO, LSTM, and hybrid models in terms of prediction accuracy, convergence speed, and robustness under varying market conditions. This approach presents a promising advancement for traders and analysts seeking intelligent tools for real-time market prediction.

title: Carbon Monoxide Concentration Prediction System Using Fuzzy Time Series-Markov Chain in Semarang
authors: Ali Bardadi, Budi Warsito, Bayu Surarso
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
abstract: It is very important to make accurate and timely predictions about hazardous atmospheric pollutants such as carbon monoxide (CO) in order to maintain air quality in densely populated and industrialized metropolitan cities such as Semarang, Indonesia. The high volatility and non-linearity of CO data pose problems for traditional forecasting models. To address this issue, this paper presents the design, implementation, and analysis of a carbon monoxide concentration prediction system based on a hybrid methodology combining Fuzzy Time Series (FTS) and first-order Markov chains. This method is designed to address linguistic uncertainty and temporal dependence in environmental data. The methodology begins with the collection of high-frequency CO data from Semarang and pre-processing. Additionally, there are various modeling steps, such as Markov chain integration to create a probabilistic transition matrix; fuzzification to convert numerical data into qualitative states; and fuzzy time series modeling to identify transition patterns (FLRG). When the system was applied to a dataset consisting of 48 high-frequency data points, a Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) value of 19.59% was obtained.

title: Corporate Governance and AI Ethics of Classification Methods Using Supervised Machine Learning for Decsion Making
authors: Anurag Shrivastava, RVS Praveen, Aboothar Mahmood Shakir, Apurv Verma, Kanchan Yadav, P. William
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: In this extensive study, a broad variety of supervised machine learning classification methods in intelligent environments are compared and contrasted with one another. A number of different algorithms, including Decision Trees, k-Nearest Neighbors, Support Vector Machines, and Artificial Neural Networks, are evaluated based on their efficacy via the use of ROC curves and precision-recall measurements. The study highlights the important trade-offs that need to be made between the complexity of the model, the efficiency of the computation, and the accuracy of the results. By paying careful attention to the ways in which algorithmic performance and dataset attributes interact with one another, the findings of the research provide insight on which classification approach is best suited for a particular set of conditions. The purpose of the research is to provide practitioners with assistance in selecting the most appropriate classification algorithms for applications using big data and the Internet of Things in smart environments.

title: Design and Optimization of Microwave Filter and Amplifier Using Machine Learning Algorithms
authors: Shanthi P, Manoj SH, Srujan Prasad
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: The work discusses an attempt to optimize the RF and microwave circuits, specifically filters and amplifiers, using advanced machine learning algorithms like Deep Q-Networks (DQN) and Random Forest. By refining key circuit parameters, the work aims to enhance performance metrics such as minimized reflection coefficients (S1,1) and optimized transmission coefficients (S2,1) and Mean square error (MSE). Through detailed simulation and validation using Advanced Design System (ADS) software and ML algorithms, it is found that DQN and Random forest helped in determining the optimized geometrical parameters and re-simulating with optimized values, the return loss S(1,1) and gain S(2,1) improved to 1% to 3% for the both filter and Amplifier designs

title: A Novel Approach to Responding to Key Data Anomalies Using Unsupervised Learning: Work In Progress
authors: Feri Hari Utami, Deris Stiawan, Dian Palupi Rini, Anto Satriyo Nugroho, Lukman Lukman
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
abstract: The Student Information System (SIS) plays a crucial role in managing educational data, supporting policy-making, planning, and budget allocation, including the School Operational Assistance (BOS) program. However, data anomalies such as duplicate identities, entry errors, and administrative inconsistencies undermine data validity. Manual anomaly handling is inefficient, particularly at a national scale. This study proposes an unsupervised machine learning approach using the One-Class Support Vector Machine (OC-SVM) to automatically and continuously detect anomalies in educational datasets. A total of 25,204 records from Bengkulu Province were used, with preprocessing involving cleaning, encoding, scaling, and data splitting. Model training includes hyperparameter tuning for optimal performance. Evaluation is conducted using accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and confusion matrix. Experimental results show that the OC-SVM model successfully detected 14,424 anomalies with an accuracy of 95%. These findings highlight the potential of automated approaches to improve the quality of national educational data and support future integration into SIS dashboards and further development through ensemble methods.

title: An Improved YOLOv11-based Algorithm for Foreign Object Detection on Coal Conveyor Belts
authors: Naining Wen, Sizhe Shang, Yunpeng Bai, Kaiyu Fan
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Computer Systems (ICCS)
abstract: Addressing the challenge of insufficient foreign object detection accuracy on mine coal conveyor belts, prevalent in environments characterized by low illumination and high noise, this paper proposes an improved YOLOv11n-based foreign object detection algorithm for coal conveyor belts. The algorithm aims to achieve high precision and high recall in foreign object detection while maintaining real-time performance. Specific improvements include: optimizing the backbone network structure by replacing the original C2PSA module with a Self-Calibrated Spatial Attention (SCSA) module; combining the RFA-Conv module with the Squeeze-and-Excitation (SE) module to enhance the extraction of local target features; and incorporating the Focaler-IOU loss function in the detection head to achieve adaptive fusion of multi-scale features and focus training on hard samples. Experimental results demonstrate that, compared to a high-performance baseline model, the proposed improved model achieved further enhancements across key metrics. Specifically, Precision (P), Recall (R), mean Average Precision (mAP), and F1-score reached 0.910, 0.902, 0.895, and 0.906, respectively. Notably, there was a significant improvement in recall, successfully reducing the miss detection rate to below 9.8%. With a parameter count of 2.67M, the model effectively reduces false and missed detections with almost no increase in parameters, providing a more efficient, accurate, and lightweight technical solution for foreign object monitoring on mine coal conveyor belts.

title: Deep Clustering with Unsupervised Representation Learning for Semiconductor Wafer Defect Pattern Analysis and Yield Improvement
authors: Sowmya A Patil, Manas M N
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Computational System and Information Technology for Sustainable Solutions (CSITSS)
abstract: Wafer defect pattern classification is a key enabler of yield optimization in semiconductor manufacturing. Conventional supervised approaches, which rely heavily on manually labeled wafer maps, are increasingly constrained by scalability issues, labeling inconsistencies, and poor adaptability to novel or rare defect modes. This paper proposes a fully unsupervised framework that combines self-supervised representation learning with density-based clustering to analyze KLARF-format wafer maps without any ground-truth labels. Four state-of-the-art learning methods-SimCLR, BYOL, MoCo v2, and DINO-are used to extract high-dimensional embeddings that capture spatial and contextual characteristics of defect distributions. These embeddings are then reduced via PCA and clustered using KMeans and DBSCAN to uncover semantically meaningful defect groups. Clustering quality is quantitatively evaluated using Silhouette Score, Davies-Bouldin Index, and Calinski-Harabasz Index, while UMAP and t-SNE visualizations aid in structural interpretation. The proposed pipeline addresses the critical challenges of class imbalance, evolving defect diversity, and the high cost of manual annotation, offering a scalable and label-free alternative for high-throughput wafer inspection.

title: Analyzing the Effectiveness of Backpropagation and Generative Models for Intrusion Detection in Network Security
authors: Shi Jinsong, Nur Hanis Sabrina Suhaimi, Nazhatul Hafizah Mohd Kamarudin, Azana Hafizah Mohamad Aman, Mohamad Kamrul Hasan, Abdul Ghafar Jaafar
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Cyber Resilience (ICCR)
abstract: Intrusion Detection systems are essential for secure guarding digital infrastructures in opposition to an increasing number of sophisticated cyber threats. However, conventional IDS models regularly struggle with low detection accuracy, excessive fake alarm rates, and limited adaptability to evolving attack styles which challenges which are exacerbated with the aid of imbalanced datasets and confined function variety. To cope with those limitations, this paper proposes a hybrid intrusion detection framework that integrates a generative set of rules with a backpropagation-based neural network to decorate detection performance and machine robustness. The proposed model utilizes a Generative algorithm to synthesize sensible attack samples, in particular for underrepresented lessons within the KDD CUP 99. Those synthetic samples augment the training datsets and help mitigate class imbalance. A multilayer perceptron trained via backpropagation serves as the center detection engine, enabling effective category of each every day and malicious site visitors. The combination of artificial statistics complements the model’s generalization capability and improves its capability to detect both recognized and 0-day attacks. Experimental assessment on the KDD CUP 99 dataset benchmark demonstrates that the proposed hybrid version drastically outperforms conventional IDS strategies in terms of detection accuracy, fake superb rate, and adaptability. The outcomes affirm the effectiveness of mixing generative studying and supervised neural networks for clever, scalable, and real-time intrusion detection.

title: Vision AI: Early Retinopathy Detection System
authors: Nilesh Dhannaseth, Rasika Masurkar, Sanskruti Guralwar, Saanvi Vaidya
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: Diabetic Retinopathy (DR) represents a significant complication associated with diabetes mellitus, manifesting when elevated blood glucose levels inflict damage upon the retinal blood vessels, which constitute the light sensitive tissue located posteriorly within the ocular structure. This condition stands as a predominant contributor to preventable visual impairment on a global scale. Identifying it early and taking action quickly are very important for preventing vision loss. However, current screening methods need experts and are often hard to access and costly, especially in areas that lack resources. New developments in artificial intelligence AI have shown great promise in automatically detecting DR, which can make screening more efficient and available to more people. This research looks at how AI models, especially deep learning methods, can be used to find diabetic retinopathy early. By using a convolutional neural network CNN model trained with large amounts of retinal images, the method we propose was very accurate in finding DR in its early stages. The findings indicate that AI-driven solutions can improve current screening procedures, shorten the time it takes to diagnose the condition, and lead to better results for patients.

title: Arbitrary Fixed-Time Sliding Mode Control for Quadrotor Trajectory Tracking Under Disturbances
authors: Ferhat Bodur, Orhan Kaplan
publish: 2025 14th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications (ICRERA)
abstract: In this paper, the arbitrary fixed-time sliding mode control (AFxSMC) strategy is investigated for a quadrotor subjected to external disturbances. To enhance reference tracking performance, an effective double closed-loop control structure consisting of inner and outer loops is proposed. The proposed sliding surface technique stabilizes the system states in a predetermined time. This stabilization is achieved, regardless of the initial system position, through the principle of arbitrary fixedtime stabilization. The validity and applicability of the proposed method are verified through quadrotor simulations. We compare the performances of different methods in the simulation studies to analyze the effectiveness of the controller. The obtained results demonstrate that the proposed method provides higher robustness and improved tracking performance compared to existing approaches.

title: Mist-Assisted Federated Learning for Intrusion Detection in Heterogeneous IoT Networks
authors: Saadat Izadi, Shakib Komasi, Ali Salimi, Alireza Rezaei, Mahmood Ahmadi
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Internet of Things and Applications (IoT)
abstract: The rapid growth of the Internet of Things (IoT) offers new opportunities but also expands the attack surface of distributed, resource-limited devices. Intrusion detection in such environments is difficult due to data heterogeneity from diverse sensing modalities and the non-IID distribution of samples across clients. Federated Learning (FL) provides a privacy-preserving alternative to centralized training, yet conventional frameworks struggle under these conditions. To address this, we propose a Mist-assisted hierarchical framework for IoT intrusion detection. A four-layer Mist-Edge-Fog-Cloud architecture is proposed to mitigate heterogeneity and preserve privacy. Evaluations on the TON-IoT dataset show the framework achieves 98-99% accuracy, PR-AUC <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$>0.97$</tex>, and stable convergence under heterogeneous and large-scale settings, while maintaining efficiency and preserving privacy.

title: A Hybrid Machine Learning Framework for Predictive Maintenance in Renewable Energy Systems to Enhance Efficiency and Longevity
authors: Udit Mamodiya, Shweta Redkar, Richa Sharma, Indra Kishor, Parul Goyal
publish: 2025 International Conference on Sustainability, Innovation &amp; Technology (ICSIT)
abstract: The implementation of solar and wind technologies has become an important aspect of any global sustainability effort, but the sustainability of these technologies can be diminished through steady depreciation of componentry over the long-term as well as surprise component failures due to the natural or environmental effects to the technology that results in downtime and less than satisfactory energy generation. Considerable modern planning and contemporary are needed in order to act proactively and decisively in each example of an incident: needing to have something beyond a conventional maintenance plan, it has developed into the need for a predictive strategy that leads to proactive identification of failure before significant depreciation of componentry results in total failure. The results of the benchmarking indicate, once again, that the hybrid method proposed in this paper outperforms benchmarks and traditional and single model based approaches, resulting in an F1-score of 94.3 % and an AUC-ROC of 95.4. The scheduling with respect to the PMI also resulted in a significant decrease in downtime, 28.6 %, and reduced inefficience, 17.4 %. The system provided not only performance gains, but also tolerated drift, and modeled for changing conditions when deployed in an edge-AI device test, with inference times under 2.1 seconds. Taken together, these results illustrate not only the efficiency of the model but also its practical viability for field deployment. The framework, by enhancing predictability and maintaining flexibility under uncertainty, contributes to the broader goal of sustainable energy management and positions hybrid machine learning as a credible enabler for smart maintenance in renewable infrastructures.

title: Adaptive PI Control with Signal Synthesis for Robust Power System Frequency Regulation
